definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: Whoever poses as a People’s policeman in order to practise fraud shall be given a heavier punishment according to the provisions of the preceding paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 冒充人民警察招摇撞骗的，依照前款的规定从重处罚。

sentences.english: He often swaggered AND swindled under the guise of the company's name.
sentences.chinese: 他经常假借公司的名义来招摇撞骗。

sentences.english: It's queer that he managed to bluff his way through all the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪他居然设法招摇撞骗闯过所有难关。

sentences.english: Whoever impersonates a people's policeman to go about and deceive people shall be given a heavier punishment in accordance with the provisions of the preceding paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 冒充人民警察招摇撞骗的，依照前款的规定从重处罚。

sentences.english: He pretended to be a journalist, and swindled lots of money.
sentences.chinese: 冒充记者招摇撞骗，诈取了不少钱财。

sentences.english: AND swindled under the guise of the company's name.
sentences.chinese: 他经常假借公司的名义来招摇撞骗。

sentences.english: It is easy in the reputation of the master pretend to be committing an act around.
sentences.chinese: 原来是张毅冒充师傅的声誉在四处招摇撞骗。

definition: lit. to wave a banner as if it were a tiger skin (idiom)/fig. to borrow sb's prestige/to take the name of a great cause as a shield
pinyin: la1 da4 qi2 zuo4 hu3 pi2

definition: to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
